greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=0, a(2)=0, a(3)=1; for n>3, a(n)=abs(a(n-1)-a(n-2)-a(n-3)).
comment: Conjecture: a(n) = m/2 where m is the smallest even distance from n to a square. - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 23 2013
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(k^2+2m+2)=k-m and a(k^2+2m+1)= m, for k>=0 and 0<=m<=k.
program: a088226_list = 0 : 0 : 1 : zipWith3 (\u v w -> abs (w - v - u))
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 04 2003
